DOC.brief_summary: To assess the safety and efficacy of CO2 insufflations during ERCP 1. Primary objective: To assess the patient's symptoms, abdominal pain and abdominal distension post procedure (ERCP) in the study group. 2. Secondary objective: Endoscopist: - To assess the adequacy of bowel distension for adequate luminal visualization - To assess the peristaltic movement during the ERCP Anesthetist: - To measure the PCO2 level in patient post procedure. - To assess the amount of sedation required during the procedure. - To assess saturation and vital signs through out the procedure. - To assess requirement of buscopan.
DOC.brief_title: Outcome of Carbon Dioxide Versus Air Insufflations During Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatography (ERCP)
DOC.criteria: All consecutive adult patients referred for ERCP to AIG Hyderabad Age < 18 years old excluded from the study. Patients with COPD. Patients with poor ejection fractions and decompensated heart failure. Patients with acute illness that require emergency ERCP and not fit for pre procedure and post procedure assessments. Patients with recent endoscopic procedure within 24 hours. Patient with history of recent surgery within 7 days of duration. Pregnant patients. Patients not keen to give consent for the study.
